statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Boise State spoils UNLV's Tarkanian tribute night, 53-48
article.headline: Boise State spoils UNLV's Tarkanian tribute night, 53-48
article.linkText: Boise State spoils UNLV's Tarkanian tribute night, 53-48
article.story: LAS VEGAS -- Derrick Marks scored 16 points, including two free throws in the final 34 seconds, to help lead Boise State to a 53-48 victory over UNLV Wednesday night. Boise State (19-7, 9-4 Mountain West Conference) has won nine of its past 10 games and is tied with Wyoming for second place in the conference behind San Diego State. Jelan Kendrick scored 15 points, but the Rebels (14-12, 5-8) shot a season-low 30 percent on 18-of-60 shooting. UNLV held a 26-21 lead at halftime but was outscored 12-2 in the first 5 1/2 minutes of the second half. The Rebels missed nine of their first 10 shots in the half. The loss came on a night that UNLV honored the late Jerry Tarkanian, who died last week at age 84. Tarkanian's Runnin' Rebels won the 1990 national championship and had four Final Four appearances. After the game, the lights on the famed Las Vegas Strip were dimmed for three minutes in honor of Tarkanian.
